column4: is there a way to get the amount of RAM used in my top bar  ?
so is there anyone with an idea of how to display the amount of RAM used ?
yes sure I know all of that but how to display them in my top bar
the system monitor applet can show your memmory usage
once apt-geted where do I launch sensors-applets ?
right click on panel - add to panel - hardware sensors
I might have to restart x I don't see them in there
you can just restart the gnome panel with sudo killall gnome-panel
I have them install, but temp1, temp2 temp3 conrespond to what exactly ?
Depends on your motherboard, whatever is the hottest is your cpu =)  and there is probably a sensor somewhere else in your motherboard (probably for the cpu cooler) and one for the temp in your case
